snippet.title: Johnny Depp, Amber Heard arrive at UK High Court for libel trial
snippet.description:
(20 Jul 2020) JOHNNY DEPP, AMBER HEARD ARRIVE AT UK HIGH COURT FOR LIBEL TRIAL
Johnny Depp and Amber Heard arrived at Britain's High Court Monday (20 JULY 2020) for the final week's proceedings in Depp's libel suit against a British tabloid that accused him of assaulting his former spouse.
After a week and a half of testimony from Depp and several current or former employees of Depp and Heard, Heard is due to give her side of the story as she enters the witness box.
Heard alleges Depp was violent towards her on 14 occasions between 2013 and 2016, in settings including Depp's private island in the Bahamas, a rented house in Australia and the couple's downtown Los Angeles penthouse.
Depp denies the allegations and claims Heard was the aggressor during their volatile relationship, which he has likened to “a crime scene waiting to happen.”
Depp is suing News Group Newspapers, publisher of The Sun, and the paper’s executive editor, Dan Wootton, over an April 2018 article that called him a “wife-beater.” He strongly denies abusing Heard.
Depp, 57, and Heard, 34, met on the set of the 2011 comedy “The Rum Diary” and married in Los Angeles in February 2015. Heard filed for divorce the following year, and the divorce was finalized in 2017.
